docs.lead_paragraph: THE ART UNION INVESTIGATION.--MEETING OF THE LEGISLATIVE COMMITTEE.--The Committee of the House of Assembly of the State Legislature, appointed to investigate the affairs of the late New-York Art Union, assembled pursuant to adjournment, 'yesterday afternoon, at the Astor House. Present Messrs. D. B. TAYLOR, B. M. CHAMPLAIN, and A. M. CLAPP.
docs.snippet: THE ART UNION INVESTIGATION.--MEETING OF THE LEGISLATIVE COMMITTEE.--The Committee of the House of Assembly of the State Legislature, appointed to investigate the affairs of the late New-York Art Union, assembled pursuant to adjournment, 'yesterday...

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. VAN BUREN is in the City, ready to sail to-morrow in the Collins' steamer Arctic for Europe. He goes in company with his son, M. VAN BUREN, Jr., who is at present in ill health. The trip will probably extend over the Continent, as well as through England, Scotland and Ireland.

docs.lead_paragraph: The City is in commotion. We might think that the pestilence was walking at noon-day,--that hourly bulletins were being issued from the office of the Health Commissioner, and that half the population expected to be buried before midnight.
docs.snippet: The City is in commotion. We might think that the pestilence was walking at noon-day,--that hourly bulletins were being issued from the office of the Health Commissioner, and that half the population expected to be buried before midnight.
